metadata.synopsis: Every week, some elderly Israelis meet among the tombstones of Jerusalem's Mount Herzl cemetery to have lunch and discuss politics, philosophy, poetry and other topics.

reviews: Both a salty comedy of uncompromising eccentricity and a requiem for a generation still sending sparks from fading embers.
It speaks to us all about the stories and experiences that make up a life, and the complicated relationships that we carry with us to the grave.
